Farming and trade of dromedary camels has increased over the past three decades in and between the Middle East and Africa. A large proportion of dromedary camels in the Middle East are imported from east African countries, where 19 million of the world's estimated population of 30 million dromedary camels reside.
11 MERS-CoV strains identified in African camels are genetically distinct from strains detected in camels in the Arabian Peninsula. 8, 9 In Africa, east and west African strains of MERS-CoV can be discriminated by their genetic markers that include accessory gene deletions that might affect the extent of virus replication or virulence.
